recipes.name: Chicken Fried Rice
instructions: Cook the rice and set aside.
In a pan, cook the diced chicken until browned.
Add chopped onion, carrot, and mushroom to the pan and stir-fry until vegetables are tender.
Push the ingredients to one side of the pan and scramble the egg on the other side.
Mix everything together and add cooked rice.
Pour in soy sauce and stir until everything is well combined.

recipes.name: Tomato and Lettuce Salad
instructions: Chop the lettuce, tomato, and onion.
In a large bowl, combine the chopped vegetables.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss everything together until well mixed.

recipes.name: Mushroom and Egg Stir-fry
instructions: Slice the mushrooms and chop the onion.
Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté the onion until translucent.
Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their juices and start to brown.
Push the vegetables to one side of the pan and scramble the eggs on the other side.
Mix everything together and add a splash of soy sauce.
Stir well and serve hot.

recipes.name: Chicken and Carrot Stew
instructions: In a large pot, heat some oil and sauté chopped onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add diced chicken and cook until browned.
Add chopped carrots and tomatoes to the pot.
Pour in chicken broth and add thyme, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer until vegetables are tender and chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Carrot and Tomato Soup
instructions: Chop the carrots, tomatoes, and onion.
In a pot, heat olive oil and sauté the onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add the carrots and cook for a few minutes.
Add the tomatoes and chicken broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer until carrots are tender.
Blend the soup until smooth and season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Chicken Lettuce Wraps
instructions: Dice the chicken and chop the onion and mushrooms.
Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté the onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add the chicken and cook until browned.
Add the mushrooms and cook until tender.
Stir in soy sauce.
Spoon the mixture into lettuce leaves and serve.

recipes.name: Tomato Egg Drop Soup
instructions: Chop the tomatoes and onion.
In a pot, heat some oil and sauté the onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add the tomatoes and cook until soft.
Pour in the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Mix cornstarch with water to make a slurry and add to the soup.
Beat the eggs and slowly drizzle them into the boiling soup while stirring to create egg ribbons.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Stuffed Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Remove the stems from the mushrooms and chop them finely.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté the chopped mushroom stems, onion, and garlic until tender.
Mix in bread crumbs and cheese, and season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the mushroom caps with the mixture.
Place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender and the tops are golden.
